verses.kjv: Even to day is my complaint bitter: my stroke is heavier than my groaning.
verses.ct: "Even now my complaint is full of bitterness; the weight of my suffering is greater than my groaning can express.

verses.kjv: Oh that I knew where I might find him! that I might come even to his seat!
verses.ct: If only I knew where to find him! If only I could go to where he sits in judgment!

verses.kjv: I would order my cause before him, and fill my mouth with arguments.
verses.ct: I would lay out my case in front of him and present every argument I have.

verses.kjv: I would know the words which he would answer me, and understand what he would say unto me.
verses.ct: I want to hear what words he would use to answer me and understand what he would say to me.

verses.kjv: Will he plead against me with his great power? No; but he would put strength in me.
verses.ct: Would he use his overwhelming power to oppose me? No — instead, he would give me strength.

verses.kjv: There the righteous might dispute with him; so should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
verses.ct: There an upright person could reason with him, and I would be permanently acquitted by my judge.

verses.kjv: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; and backward, but I cannot perceive him:
verses.ct: But look — I go forward, and he isn't there; I go backward, and I can't detect him.

verses.kjv: On the left hand, where he doth work, but I cannot behold him: he hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him:
verses.ct: When he is at work on the left, I can't see him; when he turns to the right, he's hidden from me.

verses.kjv: But he knoweth the way that I take: when he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
verses.ct: Yet he knows the path I'm walking. When he has tested me, I will emerge like pure gold.

verses.kjv: My foot hath held his steps, his way have I kept, and not declined.
verses.ct: My feet have closely followed his steps; I have stayed on his path and never wandered from it.

verses.kjv: Neither have I gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have esteemed the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
verses.ct: I have never turned away from the commands he has spoken; I have treasured the words from his mouth more than my daily food.

verses.kjv: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? and what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
verses.ct: But he has made up his mind, and who can change it? Whatever he desires, that is what he does.

verses.kjv: For he performeth the thing that is appointed for me: and many such things are with him.
verses.ct: He will carry out what he has determined for me, and he has many more such plans.

verses.kjv: Therefore am I troubled at his presence: when I consider, I am afraid of him.
verses.ct: That is why I am shaken in his presence; when I think about it, I tremble before him.

verses.kjv: For God maketh my heart soft, and the Almighty troubleth me:
verses.ct: God has made my heart weak, and the Almighty has filled me with dread.

verses.kjv: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, neither hath he covered the darkness from my face.
verses.ct: Yet I was not silenced by the darkness, nor has he hidden the thick darkness from my sight."
